intro: Centrosolenia longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled centrosolenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
